name: Court's Creamy and Quick Burritos
author: Courtney Servantes
summary: This is a simple recipe that my family loves. I passed it along to my mom several years ago and she loves it as well. I sometimes add in a can of green chilies along with a diced jalapeno to the meat mixture. Hope all will enjoy!
ingredients: 1 (10.75 ounce) can  condensed cream of mushroom soup
½ cup salsa, or to taste  (Optional)
1 ½ cups shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Cook ground beef and onion in a skillet over medium heat until the beef is completely browned, 7 to 10 minutes
Drain excess grease from the skillet
Stir refried beans, 1 cup Cheddar cheese, and   into the drained ground beef mixture
Spoon ground beef mixture down the center of each tortilla
Roll the tortillas around the beef filling
Stir cream of mushroom soup, sour cream, and salsa together in a bowl
Spread about 1/2 the cream of mushroom soup mixture into the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish
Arrange rolled tortillas into a single layer in the baking dish with the seam side down
Pour remaining cream of mushroom soup mixture over the tortillas
Bake in preheated oven until cheese is bubbly and melted, 30 to 35 minutes
